original: bu mo gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad dang ldan pa zhig btsas so //
analyzed: bu mo gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad dang ldan pa zhig btsas so //
translated: A daughter was born who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, beautiful, and endowed with all the major and minor limbs.

original: de nas de btsas pa'i btsas ston byas nas /
analyzed: de nas de btsas pa'i btsas ston byas nas /
translated: Then, when the birth celebration was held,

original: bu mo 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: bu mo 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
translated: they asked, “What name should we give this girl?”

original: nye du rnams na re /🔽bu mo 'di ka @317a *//
analyzed: nye du rnams na re / bu mo 'di ka @317a *//
translated: Her relatives said,🔽“Since this girl is the daughter of the king of Kāśi and has a beautiful body,

original: shi'i rgyal po'i bu mo yin la byad gzugs kyang bzang bas de'i phyir bu mo 'di'i ming ka shi mdzes ldan ma zhes gdags so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: shi'i rgyal po'i bu mo yin la byad gzugs kyang bzang bas de'i phyir bu mo 'di'i ming ka shi mdzes ldan ma zhes gdags so zhes zer ro //
translated: let us name this girl Kāśisundarī.”

original: de nas bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma phang na 'tsho ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / nu ma snun pa'i ma ma gnyis dang / dri ma 'khru ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / rtse ba'i ma ma gnyis te /
analyzed: de nas bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma phang na 'tsho ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / nu ma snun pa'i ma ma gnyis dang / dri ma 'khru ba'i ma ma gnyis dang / rtse ba'i ma ma gnyis te /
translated: Then the girl Kāśisundarī was entrusted to two nursemaids, two wet nurses, two maids to clean her, and two playmates.

original: ma ma brgyad la gtad nas de ma brgyad kyis 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / zhun mar dang / mar gyi snying khu dang / gzhan yang yo byad kyi khyad par bzang ngo cog gis skyed srings te /
analyzed: ma ma brgyad la gtad nas de ma brgyad kyis 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / zhun mar dang / mar gyi snying khu dang / gzhan yang yo byad kyi khyad par bzang ngo cog gis skyed srings te /
translated: He entrusted her to eight nurses, who reared her with milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids, and with other excellent and special kinds of provisions,

original: mtsho'i nang gi padma bzhin du skye drag par gyur to //
analyzed: mtsho'i nang gi padma bzhin du skye drag par gyur to //
translated: and she grew quickly, flourishing like a lotus in a lake.

original: de nas gang gi tshe bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma chen mor gyur pa de'i tshe nyi 'og gi rgyal po drug gis rgyal po tshangs pas byin la pho nya btang ste /
analyzed: de nas gang gi tshe bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma chen mor gyur pa de'i tshe nyi 'og gi rgyal po drug gis rgyal po tshangs pas byin la pho nya btang ste /
translated: “When the girl Kaśisundarī grew up, six neighboring kings sent a message to King Brahmadatta:

original: khyod kyi bu mo btsas zhes bdag gis thos kyi /
analyzed: khyod kyi bu mo btsas zhes bdag gis thos kyi /
translated: ‘We have heard that your daughter has been born.

original: gzhan la mi sbyin par bdag gi bu la byin cig ces spring ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la mi sbyin par bdag gi bu la byin cig ces spring ngo //
translated: Do not give her to anyone else! Give her to our son!’

original: de nas rgyal po tshangs pas byin mya ngan gyi khang bur bzhugs nas; lag pa la rkom tshugs btsas te bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po tshangs pas byin mya ngan gyi khang bur bzhugs nas; lag pa la rkom tshugs btsas te bsams pa /
translated: “King Brahmadatta then sat down in a sorrow chamber, put his elbows on his knees, and thought,

original: gal te gcig la byin na ni gzhan rnams ni bdag gi dgrar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: gal te gcig la byin na ni gzhan rnams ni bdag gi dgrar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: ‘If I give her to one, the others will become my enemies.’

original: sems khong du chud cing 'dug go /
analyzed: sems khong du chud cing 'dug go /
translated: He was sitting there, his mind in turmoil.

original: de nas re zhig na bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma rgyan thams cad kyis klubs te pha'i thad du song ba dang / des pha mya ngan gyis non pa mthong nas bris pa /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma rgyan thams cad kyis klubs te pha'i thad du song ba dang / des pha mya ngan gyis non pa mthong nas bris pa /
translated: After some time, the girl Kāśisundarī, adorned with all her jewelry, went to her father. When she saw that he was overcome with grief, she asked,

original: yab ci'i slad du mya ngan mdzad //
analyzed: yab ci'i slad du mya ngan mdzad //
translated: “Father, why are you grieving?”

original: de @317b nas phas kyang de la ji ltar gyur pa bsnyad do //
analyzed: de @317b nas phas kyang de la ji ltar gyur pa bsnyad do //
translated: Then her father told her what had happened.

original: de nas bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan mas pha la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan mas pha la smras pa /
translated: The girl Kāśisundarī said to her father,

original: yab / nyi log gi rgyal po rnams la nga ste nas /
analyzed: yab / nyi log gi rgyal po rnams la nga ste nas /
translated: “Father, send a messenger to the kings of the neighboring countries, saying,

original: bdun na bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma rang nyid kyi khyim thab 'dam par chad kyi /
analyzed: bdun na bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma rang nyid kyi khyim thab 'dam par chad kyi /
translated: ‘In seven days, the girl Kāśisundarī will choose her own husband.🔽Do whatever you need to do.’

original: khyed kyi bya ba gang yin pa de gyis shig ces pho nya gtang du gsol zhes byas so //
analyzed: khyed kyi bya ba gang yin pa de gyis shig ces pho nya gtang du gsol zhes byas so //
translated: Please send a messenger to tell him to do whatever it is he is supposed to do.

original: de nas zhag bdun lon pa dang / nyi 'og gi rgyal po drug po de rnams 'dus so //
analyzed: de nas zhag bdun lon pa dang / nyi 'og gi rgyal po drug po de rnams 'dus so //
translated: Then, after seven days had passed, the six kings of the neighboring countries gathered.

original: bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma'ang shing rta la zhon te /
analyzed: bu mo ka shi mdzes ldan ma'ang shing rta la zhon te /
translated: The girl Kāśisundarī mounted a chariot

original: chos gos tshon can gyi ba dan bsgreng nas /
analyzed: chos gos tshon can gyi ba dan bsgreng nas /
translated: He raised a banner of dyed cloth

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs lag na thogs te; rgyal po 'dus pa'i nang du song nas smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs lag na thogs te; rgyal po 'dus pa'i nang du song nas smras pa /
translated: and, holding an image of the Blessed Buddha in his hand, he went into the assembly of kings and said,

original: kye; nyi 'og gi rgyal po rnams gson gcig /
analyzed: kye; nyi 'og gi rgyal po rnams gson gcig /
translated: “Hey, you kings of the neighboring lands, listen!

original: bdag ni khyed kyi gzugs dang / lang tsho dang / rigs dang / longs spyod dang / dbang phyug la mi sems kyi bdag ni 'dod pa rnams la don du gnyer ba ma lags te /
analyzed: bdag ni khyed kyi gzugs dang / lang tsho dang / rigs dang / longs spyod dang / dbang phyug la mi sems kyi bdag ni 'dod pa rnams la don du gnyer ba ma lags te /
translated: I do not care about your forms, youth, family, wealth, or power. I am not interested in sensual pleasures.

original: bdag ni ras 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs bris pa gang yin pa de'i slob ma lags te; de'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung ngo zhes byas nas drang srong smra bar song ste /
analyzed: bdag ni ras 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs bris pa gang yin pa de'i slob ma lags te; de'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung ngo zhes byas nas drang srong smra bar song ste /
translated: I am a disciple of the one whose image I have painted on this cloth, and I will go forth in his doctrine.”🔽Then he went to Ṛṣivadana,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal nas /
translated: prostrated at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, I wish to go forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One.”

original: btsun pa / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong ma'i dngos po 'thob tu rung na /🔽bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad @318a *//
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong ma'i dngos po 'thob tu rung na / bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad @318a *//
translated: complete the monastic life, and attain the state of a nun.

original: du tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa 'tshal lo //
analyzed: du tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa 'tshal lo //
translated: I too would like to practice pure conduct in the presence of the Blessed One.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen po la gtad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen po la gtad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One entrusted her to Mahāprajāpatī.

original: de nas des kyang de rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de nas des kyang de rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Then she went forth and was fully ordained.

original: des brtson pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / 'bad pas phol mig lnga pa'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di nyid g-yo zhing mi brtan par rig nas /
analyzed: des brtson pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / 'bad pas phol mig lnga pa'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di nyid g-yo zhing mi brtan par rig nas /
translated: Through diligence, practice, and effort, she understood that this very five-spoked wheel of cyclic existence is unstable and unsteady.

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad snyil ba dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin par rtsad chod de /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad snyil ba dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin par rtsad chod de /
translated: She resolved that all conditioned things are subject to decay, falling, dispersal, and destruction.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: He then manifested arhatship, having abandoned all afflictive emotions.

original: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
translated: As an arhat, he was free from desire for the three realms.

original: gser dang / bong bar mnyam pa /
analyzed: gser dang / bong bar mnyam pa /
translated: He regarded gold as equal to a clod of earth.

original: nam mkha' dang / lag 'thil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / lag 'thil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: His mind was like the sky or the palm of his hand.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: He was as cool as a sandalwood tree.

original: rig pas sgo nga'i spubs bcom pa /
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i spubs bcom pa /
translated: He had shattered the eggshell of ignorance with the vajra of knowledge.

original: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: He had attained the superknowledges and the discriminating knowledges.

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang / chags pa dang / bkur sti la mi lta ba /🔽dbang po dang / nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang / gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to; ;de nas rgyal po'i bu de dag gis de'i gzugs dang / lang tsho dang / mdzes pa rjes su dran nas /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang / chags pa dang / bkur sti la mi lta ba / dbang po dang / nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang / gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to; ;de nas rgyal po'i bu de dag gis de'i gzugs dang / lang tsho dang / mdzes pa rjes su dran nas /
translated: He was not concerned with worldly gain, attachment, or honor.🔽He became an object of offering, veneration, and respectful address by Indra, Upendra, and the other gods.

original: 'dod chags kyi rgyags pas myos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rgyags pas myos te /
translated: “Then, remembering his beauty, youth, and charm, the princes became intoxicated by the madness of desire.

original: rab tu byung bzhin du yang gsol ba @318b 'debs so //
analyzed: rab tu byung bzhin du yang gsol ba @318b 'debs so //
translated: Even though they were renunciants, they made requests.

original: de nas de dag gis gsol ba btab nas /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis gsol ba btab nas /
translated: Then, after they made their requests,

original: ngad pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang pa bzhin du nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: ngad pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang pa bzhin du nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
translated: like the king of geese with outstretched wings, she rose up into the sky

original: cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs bstan to; ;so so'i skye bo rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyis myur du dad par byed de /
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs bstan to; ;so so'i skye bo rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyis myur du dad par byed de /
translated: and displayed various miracles. Ordinary beings are quickly brought to faith by miracles,

original: de nas rgyal po'i bu de dag gis lha dang / mi rnams dad par byed pa'i cho 'phrul shin tu rmad du byung ba mthong nas spu zing zhes byed de /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i bu de dag gis lha dang / mi rnams dad par byed pa'i cho 'phrul shin tu rmad du byung ba mthong nas spu zing zhes byed de /
translated: so when the princes saw the extremely marvelous miracles that brought faith to gods and humans, their body hairs quivered,

original: rkang pa la phyag btsal nas bzod pa gsol te /
analyzed: rkang pa la phyag btsal nas bzod pa gsol te /
translated: they bowed down at her feet, and asked for her forgiveness.

original: sru / khyod kyi chos 'di lta bu dag mngon sum du byas pa las na /
analyzed: sru / khyod kyi chos 'di lta bu dag mngon sum du byas pa las na /
translated: “Sister, since you have actualized such qualities as these,

original: khyod 'dod pa spyod pa 'di ni mi srid kyi bzod par mdzod cig ces byas so //
analyzed: khyod 'dod pa spyod pa 'di ni mi srid kyi bzod par mdzod cig ces byas so //
translated: it is impossible for you to be enjoying sense pleasures. Please forgive us.”

original: de nas bu mo dka shi mdzes ldan ma nam mkha' las babs te /
analyzed: de nas bu mo dka shi mdzes ldan ma nam mkha' las babs te /
translated: Then the girl Kaśisundarī descended from the sky🔽and said to her brothers,🔽“Gentlemen, I have actualized the Dharma.

original: skye bo mang po'i gung la 'dug nas chos de lta bu dag bstan te /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i gung la 'dug nas chos de lta bu dag bstan te /
translated: He taught the Dharma to the assembly of many people.

original: de thos nas srog chags 'bum phrag du mas khyad par chen po thob bo //
analyzed: de thos nas srog chags 'bum phrag du mas khyad par chen po thob bo //
translated: Having heard it, many hundreds of thousands of living beings attained great distinction.

original: de nas dge slong dag /
analyzed: de nas dge slong dag /
translated: Then the monks,

original: the tshom skyes te /
analyzed: the tshom skyes te /
translated: having doubts,

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: asked the Blessed Buddha, the Destroyer of all Doubts,

original: btsun pa / ka shi mdzes ldan mas las gang dag bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa / ka shi mdzes ldan mas las gang dag bgyis na /
translated: “Venerable One, what karma did Kāśisundarī create

original: des gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa dang / rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis pa lags /
analyzed: des gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa dang / rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis pa lags /
translated: that she had a beautiful form, was pleasant to behold, and was lovely, and that she attained manifest complete awakening after going forth?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: ka shi mdzes ldan ma nyid kyi sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub pa dang ldan te /
translated: Kāśisundarī herself, in other previous lives, accumulated the requisites and possessed the conditions

original: dba' rgal bzhin @319a *//
analyzed: dba' rgal bzhin @319a *//
translated: like the rising of the tide.

original: du 'byung la gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i las de dag byas shing bsags pas na /
analyzed: du 'byung la gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i las de dag byas shing bsags pas na /
translated: She performed and accumulated those karmas that were certain to come,🔽like the rising of the tide.

original: ka shi mdzes ldan ma nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa de dag gzhan su zhig gi nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ka shi mdzes ldan ma nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa de dag gzhan su zhig gi nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Who else will experience the actions that Kashisundari herself has performed and accumulated?

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: las byas shing bsags pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: las byas shing bsags pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
translated: actions that have been performed and accumulated do not ripen upon the external elements of earth,

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: water, fire, or wind.

original: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa rnams ni zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'ba' zhig la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa rnams ni zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'ba' zhig la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Rather, virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that have been performed and accumulated will ripen upon the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that are appropriated.

original: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
translated: The actions of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za /
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za /
translated: do not perish even after a hundred eons.

original: tshogs shing dus la babs pa na /
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la babs pa na /
translated: When the conditions are assembled and the time comes,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
translated: they will certainly bear fruit.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: in the past,

original: bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye dgu'i tshe lo sum khri thub pa na /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye dgu'i tshe lo sum khri thub pa na /
translated: in this fortunate eon, when the lifespan of beings was thirty thousand years,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: the Tathāgata,

original: dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa /
translated: the Arhat,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: the Perfectly Awakened One,

original: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: the One of Sharp Insight,🔽the One of Well-Accomplished Conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the Sugata,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: the Knower of the World,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /🔽bla na med pa /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba / bla na med pa /
translated: the Leader of Men to be Tamed,

original: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: the Teacher of Gods and Men,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gser thub ces bya ba 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gser thub ces bya ba 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: the Buddha, the Blessed One, Kanakamuni.

original: de nas re zhig na rgyal po'i bu mo de dad pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na rgyal po'i bu mo de dad pa dang ldan la /
translated: “Then, at one time, there was a king’s daughter who was faithful,

original: dge zhing bsam @319b pa bzang ba zhig yod pa des btsug lag khang zhig brtsig tu bcug ste /
analyzed: dge zhing bsam @319b pa bzang ba zhig yod pa des btsug lag khang zhig brtsig tu bcug ste /
translated: virtuous, and good-natured. She had a temple built

original: yo byad thams cad kyis gang bar byas nas /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad kyis gang bar byas nas /
translated: and filled it with all the necessary things,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la phul lo; ;yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi ring la'ang rab tu byung nas lo khri'i bar du byams pa bsgoms so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la phul lo; ;yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi ring la'ang rab tu byung nas lo khri'i bar du byams pa bsgoms so //
translated: and offered it to the Blessed One together with the community of disciples. She also went forth in the presence of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa and practiced loving kindness for ten thousand years.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think?

original: de'i tshe rgyal po'i bu mor gyur pa gang yin pa de ni ka shi'i mdzes ldan ma 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po'i bu mor gyur pa gang yin pa de ni ka shi'i mdzes ldan ma 'di yin te /

translated: she was given the name Rasta.

original: de nas gang gi tshe mthar gyis bag mar gtang ran par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas gang gi tshe mthar gyis bag mar gtang ran par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the time came for her to be given in marriage,

original: su la byin na'ang mi sdug ches pas sus kyang ma blangs so //
analyzed: su la byin na'ang mi sdug ches pas sus kyang ma blangs so //
translated: no one would take her because she was so ugly.

original: de nas re zhig na lho phyogs nas ded dpon gang ga zhes bya ba phyug chen zhig 'ongs so //
analyzed: de nas re zhig na lho phyogs nas ded dpon gang ga zhes bya ba phyug chen zhig 'ongs so //
translated: Then, after some time, a great rich man named Ganges, a ship captain from the south, arrived.

original: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blo skyes pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blo skyes pa /
translated: Then King Prasenajit thought,

original: ded dpon gang ga 'di ni 'di'i skyon gyi rgyus mi shes kyis ngas 'di de la sbyin gor ma chag snyam mo //
analyzed: ded dpon gang ga 'di ni 'di'i skyon gyi rgyus mi shes kyis ngas 'di de la sbyin gor ma chag snyam mo //
translated: “This caravan leader Gaṅgapāla does not know the reason for this. I must certainly give him my daughter.”

original: de nas rgyal pos mtshan mo mun sros pa dang / gang ga pho nyas bkug nas bu mo de rgyan thams cad kyis bklubs te chung mar byin no //
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos mtshan mo mun sros pa dang / gang ga pho nyas bkug nas bu mo de rgyan thams cad kyis bklubs te chung mar byin no //
translated: Then, when night had fallen, the king summoned Gaṅgapāla, and he gave his daughter, adorned with all kinds of ornaments, to him as his wife.

original: de nas ra stha gang ga la byin nas gang gar stha gang ga ra stha zhes bya ba'i ming byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas ra stha gang ga la byin nas gang gar stha gang ga ra stha zhes bya ba'i ming byung bar gyur to //
translated: Then, after Gaṅgapāla was given to Gaṅgā, the name “Gaṅgārāṣṭra” came into existence.

original: de nas re zhig na ded dpon gang gas phyi de nyin par @333b nam nangs te /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na ded dpon gang gas phyi de nyin par @333b nam nangs te /
translated: Then, after some time, the caravan leader Gaṅgapāla woke up the next morning

original: bu mo de bltas na mchog tu mi sdug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: bu mo de bltas na mchog tu mi sdug pa mthong ngo //
translated: and saw that the girl was extremely ugly.

original: mthong nas kyang skrag par gyur kyang rgyal po las bsams te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang skrag par gyur kyang rgyal po las bsams te /
translated: When he saw her, he was frightened, but he thought about the king

original: 'dor ma phod nas bdag gi khyim 'ba' zhig tu 'jog go /
analyzed: 'dor ma phod nas bdag gi khyim 'ba' zhig tu 'jog go /
translated: and could not bring himself to abandon her. He kept her only in his own house.

original: de nas re zhig na ded dpon gang ga dus ston zhig la chas te /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na ded dpon gang ga dus ston zhig la chas te /
translated: Then, after some time, the caravan leader Gaṅgapāla set out for a festival.

original: mdza' sde rnams kyi nang du song ngo //
analyzed: mdza' sde rnams kyi nang du song ngo //
translated: He went to the assembly of his friends.

original: mdza' sde rnams kyis kyang nang khrims bcas te /
analyzed: mdza' sde rnams kyis kyang nang khrims bcas te /
translated: The friends had made an agreement among themselves:

original: su chung ma dang bcas te skyed mos tshal ga ge mo zhig tu ma song ba de mdza' sde rnams la chad par k'ar sha pa na lnga brgya sbyin du gzhug go zhes byas so //
analyzed: su chung ma dang bcas te skyed mos tshal ga ge mo zhig tu ma song ba de mdza' sde rnams la chad par k'ar sha pa na lnga brgya sbyin du gzhug go zhes byas so //
translated: “Whoever does not go to the park with his wife will be fined five hundred kārṣāpaṇas by the friends.”

original: de nas gang ga bdag gi khyim du 'ongs nas mya ngan gyi khang bur zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas gang ga bdag gi khyim du 'ongs nas mya ngan gyi khang bur zhugs te /
translated: Then Gaṅgapāla came to his house and entered the house of sorrow.

original: lag pa la rkom tshugs bcas nas sems khong du chung cing 'dug go /
analyzed: lag pa la rkom tshugs bcas nas sems khong du chung cing 'dug go /
translated: He sat there with his elbows on his knees and his chin in his hands, his mind troubled.

original: de nas de blo skyes pa /
analyzed: de nas de blo skyes pa /
translated: Then this thought occurred to him:

original: ma la / bdag gis chad pa 'jal ba ni ches bla yi /
analyzed: ma la / bdag gis chad pa 'jal ba ni ches bla yi /
translated: “It would be better for me to pay the fine.

original: bdag gis 'di de dag la bstan du ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di de dag la bstan du ni mi rung ste /
translated: But it is not right for me to show her to them.

original: mthong ma thag tu gtam ngan par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu gtam ngan par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam mo //
translated: As soon as they see her, they will gossip.”

original: de nas gang gis sgo bcad de chad pa k'ar sha pa na lnga brgya khyer nas mdza' sde rnams kyi nang du song ngo //
analyzed: de nas gang gis sgo bcad de chad pa k'ar sha pa na lnga brgya khyer nas mdza' sde rnams kyi nang du song ngo //
translated: Then Gaṅgapāla closed the door, took the fine of five hundred kārṣāpaṇas, and went to the assembly of his friends.

original: de nas bu mo de yid mi dga' ba chen po skyes nas /
analyzed: de nas bu mo de yid mi dga' ba chen po skyes nas /
translated: Then the woman became very unhappy.

original: bdag 'tsho ba 'di 'dra bas 'tsho bas ci rung /
analyzed: bdag 'tsho ba 'di 'dra bas 'tsho bas ci rung /
translated: “What is the use of living such a life?

original: gson cing 'dug na khyim thab kyang sems mi bde la bdag kyang sems mi bde /
analyzed: gson cing 'dug na khyim thab kyang sems mi bde la bdag kyang sems mi bde /
translated: If I stay alive, my husband will be unhappy and I will be unhappy.

original: da ni bdag gis bdag gsad pa'i dus la bab bo snyam mo //
analyzed: da ni bdag gis bdag gsad pa'i dus la bab bo snyam mo //
translated: Now is the time for me to kill myself.”

original: de nas thag pa khyer te khang phugs su 'gegs su song ngo //🔽de'i skabs su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni mi mkhyen pa'am /🔽mi gzigs pa'am /🔽mi rtogs @334a *//
analyzed: de nas thag pa khyer te khang phugs su 'gegs su song ngo // de'i skabs su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni mi mkhyen pa'am / mi gzigs pa'am / mi rtogs @334a *//
translated: Then she took a rope and went to the roof to hang herself.

original: pa'am / thugs su mi chud pa ci yang med la /
analyzed: pa'am / thugs su mi chud pa ci yang med la /
translated: At that time, there is nothing that the blessed buddhas do not know, do not see, do not notice, or do not perceive.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pa la zhugs pa /🔽srung ba gcig pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pa la zhugs pa / srung ba gcig pa dang ldan pa /
translated: The blessed buddhas have great compassion. They are dedicated to benefiting the world.🔽They are the protectors.

original: gcig tu dpa' ba /
analyzed: gcig tu dpa' ba /
translated: They are the only heroes.

original: zla med pa /
analyzed: zla med pa /
translated: They are without rivals.

original: gnyis su mi gsung ba /
analyzed: gnyis su mi gsung ba /
translated: They do not speak in two ways.

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la gnas pa /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la gnas pa /
translated: They abide in tranquility and insight.

original: rig pa gsum snang bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: rig pa gsum snang bar mdzad pa /
translated: They illuminate the three knowledges.

original: bslab pa gsum la legs par bslabs pa /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum la legs par bslabs pa /
translated: He was well trained in the three trainings.

original: 'dul ba'i gzhi gsum la mkhas pa /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i gzhi gsum la mkhas pa /
translated: He was skilled in the three bases of the vinaya.

original: chu bo bzhi las brgal pa /
analyzed: chu bo bzhi las brgal pa /
translated: He had crossed the four rivers.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'i zhabs kyi mthil shin tu brtan pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'i zhabs kyi mthil shin tu brtan pa /
translated: The soles of his feet were very stable with the four bases of miraculous power.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la yun ring po nas 'dris par byas pa /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la yun ring po nas 'dris par byas pa /
translated: He had long been familiar with the four means of gathering.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhis mi 'jigs pa /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhis mi 'jigs pa /
translated: He was fearless with the four fearlessnesses.

original: khyu mchog gi yang dag pa'i seng ge'i sgra chen po sgrogs pa /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi yang dag pa'i seng ge'i sgra chen po sgrogs pa /
translated: He proclaimed the great lion’s roar of the supreme leader.

original: yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa; 'grong lnga las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa; 'grong lnga las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: He had abandoned the five branches and had completely transcended the five destinies.

original: yan lag drug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan pa /
translated: He possessed the six branches.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: He had perfected the six perfections.

original: rtag par gnas par bya ba drug la gnas pa /
analyzed: rtag par gnas par bya ba drug la gnas pa /
translated: He was abiding in the six ways of abiding.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis phyug pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis phyug pa /
translated: He was rich with the flowers of the seven branches of enlightenment.

original: lam yan lag brgyad pa ston pa /
analyzed: lam yan lag brgyad pa ston pa /
translated: He taught the eightfold path.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa /
translated: He was skilled in the nine successive absorptions.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
translated: He possessed the power of the ten powers.

original: phyogs bcur grags pas kun tu rgyas pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcur grags pas kun tu rgyas pa /
translated: It is renowned in the ten directions and is completely pervasive.🔽It is superior to the one who has power over a hundred times a hundred.

original: brgya phrag bcu pa la dbang byed pa bas kyang ches khyad par du 'phags pa rnams ni chos nyid kyis nyin dus gsum /
analyzed: brgya phrag bcu pa la dbang byed pa bas kyang ches khyad par du 'phags pa rnams ni chos nyid kyis nyin dus gsum /
translated: By the nature of reality, three times during the day and three times during the night,

original: mtshan dus gsum du sangs @334b rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te /🔽su ni rgud /🔽su ni dar /🔽su ni phongs shing 'dug /
analyzed: mtshan dus gsum du sangs @334b rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te / su ni rgud / su ni dar / su ni phongs shing 'dug /
translated: the Buddha looks out upon the world with his buddha eye.🔽He sees who is flourishing and who is declining.

original: su ni nyam nga bar gyur /
analyzed: su ni nyam nga bar gyur /
translated: He sees who is in distress and who is not.

original: su ni gnod pa dang ldan /🔽su ni phongs pa dang / nyam nga pa dang / gnod pa dang ldan /🔽su ni ngan song du gzhol; su ni ngan song du 'bab /
analyzed: su ni gnod pa dang ldan / su ni phongs pa dang / nyam nga pa dang / gnod pa dang ldan / su ni ngan song du gzhol; su ni ngan song du 'bab /
translated: He sees who is suffering and who is not.🔽He sees who is in distress, suffering, and misfortune.

original: su ni ngan song du bab /🔽su ni ngas ngan song nas phyung ste /
analyzed: su ni ngan song du bab / su ni ngas ngan song nas phyung ste /
translated: He sees who is headed for the lower realms, who is in the lower realms, and who has fallen into the lower realms.

original: mtho ris dang / thar pa dang / 'bras bu la gzhag par bya /
analyzed: mtho ris dang / thar pa dang / 'bras bu la gzhag par bya /
translated: He sees who he should pull out of the lower realms and establish in the higher realms, in liberation, and in the fruits.

original: su ni 'dod pa'i 'dam du bying ba las lag nas drang bar bya /
analyzed: su ni 'dod pa'i 'dam du bying ba las lag nas drang bar bya /
translated: He sees who he should pull out of the mud of desire by the hand.

original: su ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun med pa las 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du gzhug par bya /
analyzed: su ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun med pa las 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du gzhug par bya /
translated: Who should I establish in the sovereignty of the seven riches of the noble ones, who are devoid of the seven riches of the noble ones?

original: su ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma bskyed pa las bskyed par bya /
analyzed: su ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma bskyed pa las bskyed par bya /
translated: Who has not yet generated the roots of virtue, whom should I cause to generate the roots of virtue?

original: su ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin pa las yongs su smin par bya /
analyzed: su ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin pa las yongs su smin par bya /
translated: Who has already generated the roots of virtue, whom should I cause to ripen?

original: su ni yongs su smin zin pa las rnam par grol bar bya snyam du ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
analyzed: su ni yongs su smin zin pa las rnam par grol bar bya snyam du ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
translated: Who has already ripened, whom should I cause to be liberated?’

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rgya mtsho chu srin rnams kyi gnas //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chu srin rnams kyi gnas //
translated: The ocean is the abode of sea monsters.

original: dus rlabs yol bar 'gyur yang srid //
analyzed: dus rlabs yol bar 'gyur yang srid //
translated: It is possible that the tide will recede.

original: gdul bar bya ba'i sras rnams la //
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i sras rnams la //
translated: But for the disciples to be tamed,

original: sangs rgyas dus la yol ba med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dus la yol ba med //
translated: the Buddha never misses the right time.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs pas 'od zer gser gyi kha dog can bkye ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs pas 'od zer gser gyi kha dog can bkye ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One, dwelling in the garden of Prince Jeta, emitted a ray of golden light.

original: des khyim de nyi ma stong shar ba bzhin du snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: des khyim de nyi ma stong shar ba bzhin du snang bar byas nas /
translated: It illuminated that house as if a thousand suns had risen.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis kyang der gshegs te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis kyang der gshegs te /
translated: He also went there by his miraculous power.

original: 'gul pa nas 'gag thag bkrol nas bu mo de dbugs phyung ngo //
analyzed: 'gul pa nas 'gag thag bkrol nas bu mo de dbugs phyung ngo //
translated: She was freed from the noose of death and the girl was revived.

original: 'jig rten du ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i gnas drug 'byung ba yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i gnas drug 'byung ba yod de /
translated: There are six marvelous and wonderful things that appear in the world:

original: de bzhin @335a *//
analyzed: de bzhin @335a *//
translated: the Tathāgata,🔽the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata,🔽birth as a human,🔽birth in a central country,🔽complete faculties,

original: gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba dang / mir skye ba dang / 'phags pa gnas par skye ba dang / dbang po tshang ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba 'jig rten du byung ba yod do //
analyzed: gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba dang / mir skye ba dang / 'phags pa gnas par skye ba dang / dbang po tshang ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba 'jig rten du byung ba yod do //
translated: and aspiration for virtuous qualities.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bu mo de la de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bu mo de la de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One taught the girl a Dharma discourse suited to her,

original: de thos nas bu mo des 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
analyzed: de thos nas bu mo des 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
translated: and having heard it, the girl destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so //
translated: and manifested the resultant state of stream entry.

original: de nas dad pa rnyed nas bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol te na bza' yang phul lo //
analyzed: de nas dad pa rnyed nas bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol te na bza' yang phul lo //
translated: Then, having gained faith, she offered the Blessed One food and clothing.

original: de nas bu mo de'i mi sdug pa med par gyur te bzang mor gyur nas lha'i bu mo bzhin du khang phugs 'od kyis snang bar byas te 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas bu mo de'i mi sdug pa med par gyur te bzang mor gyur nas lha'i bu mo bzhin du khang phugs 'od kyis snang bar byas te 'dug go /
translated: Then the girl’s ugliness disappeared and she became beautiful, like a daughter of the gods, and the house was filled with light.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang slar gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang slar gshegs so //
translated: The Blessed One then departed.

original: de nas bu mdza' sde bo rnams kyi blo skyes pa /
analyzed: de nas bu mdza' sde bo rnams kyi blo skyes pa /
translated: Then the young men thought,

original: gor ma chags par 'di'i chung ma ni mchog tu sdug pa zhig na des phrag dog gis rang bzhin gyis chad pa 'jal ba dang bsngos te /
analyzed: gor ma chags par 'di'i chung ma ni mchog tu sdug pa zhig na des phrag dog gis rang bzhin gyis chad pa 'jal ba dang bsngos te /
translated: “There’s no doubt that his wife is extremely beautiful. Out of jealousy, he has imposed a fine and a curse.

original: de bstan par ni mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de bstan par ni mi 'dod kyi /
translated: He doesn’t want us to see her.

original: bdag cag gis 'di chang sna mi mthun pas ra ro bar byas la lde mig rnams blangs te /
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di chang sna mi mthun pas ra ro bar byas la lde mig rnams blangs te /
translated: We will get him drunk on different kinds of beer, take his keys,

original: 'di'i khyim du song la chung ma blta'o snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di'i khyim du song la chung ma blta'o snyam mo //
translated: and go to his house to see his wife.”

original: de nas de dag gis chang gar po sna mi mthun pas gtu lum par bas nas /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis chang gar po sna mi mthun pas gtu lum par bas nas /
translated: Then they got him drunk on different kinds of strong beer.

original: lde mig rnams khyer te khyim du song nas sgo rnams phye ste bu mo de mthong @335b ngo; ;mthong nas kyang ya mtshan du gyur te bsams pa /
analyzed: lde mig rnams khyer te khyim du song nas sgo rnams phye ste bu mo de mthong @335b ngo; ;mthong nas kyang ya mtshan du gyur te bsams pa /
translated: When he saw her, he was amazed and thought,

original: gang gas 'di bdag cag la mi bstan ni yus so snyam mo //
analyzed: gang gas 'di bdag cag la mi bstan ni yus so snyam mo //
translated: “She is not showing herself to us because she is angry.”

original: de nas de dag phyir log ste /
analyzed: de nas de dag phyir log ste /
translated: Then they returned home.

original: gang ga chang gi dbang gis gnyid log cing 'dug pa las bslang nas smras pa /
analyzed: gang ga chang gi dbang gis gnyid log cing 'dug pa las bslang nas smras pa /
translated: They woke up Gaṅgā, who was sleeping from the effects of the wine, and said,

original: gang ga / khyod kyi chung ma de ltar sdug pa ni khyod kyis rnyed pa legs par rnyed do zhes byas so //
analyzed: gang ga / khyod kyi chung ma de ltar sdug pa ni khyod kyis rnyed pa legs par rnyed do zhes byas so //
translated: “Gaṅgā, you have found a wife as beautiful as this. You have found a good thing!”

original: de nas gang ga lhag par yang mi dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas gang ga lhag par yang mi dga' bar gyur te /
translated: Then Gaṅgā became even more unhappy.

original: chad pa'ang bdag gis gcal la /
analyzed: chad pa'ang bdag gis gcal la /
translated: “I have been punished,

original: bdag la gtam ngan par yang gyur to snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag la gtam ngan par yang gyur to snyam mo //
translated: and I have become the talk of the town.”

original: de nas mi dga' bzhin du bdag gi khyim du 'ongs nas sgo phye ste chung ma la bltas na nags tshal me tog rgyas pa'i nang na nags kyi lha mo 'dug pa bzhin du shin tu mdzes pa mthong nas dris pa /
analyzed: de nas mi dga' bzhin du bdag gi khyim du 'ongs nas sgo phye ste chung ma la bltas na nags tshal me tog rgyas pa'i nang na nags kyi lha mo 'dug pa bzhin du shin tu mdzes pa mthong nas dris pa /
translated: Then, unwillingly, he went home. When he opened the door and saw his wife, she was as beautiful as a forest goddess in a flowering forest. He asked,

original: bzang mo de ci /
analyzed: bzang mo de ci /
translated: “What is this, my dear?

original: ci zhig byas na 'di lta bu'i gzugs khyad par can du gyur ces byas so //
analyzed: ci zhig byas na 'di lta bu'i gzugs khyad par can du gyur ces byas so //
translated: What did you do to get such a special body?”

original: de nas ji ltar gyur pa thams cad khyim thab la bsnyad de /
analyzed: de nas ji ltar gyur pa thams cad khyim thab la bsnyad de /
translated: Then she told her husband everything that had happened.

original: de thos nas des kyang bcom ldan 'das la dad pa rnyed do //
analyzed: de thos nas des kyang bcom ldan 'das la dad pa rnyed do //
translated: When he heard it, he too gained faith in the Blessed One.

original: de nas re zhig na bu mo des mthar gyis khyim thab la gsol te /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na bu mo des mthar gyis khyim thab la gsol te /
translated: Then after some time the girl asked her husband’s permission

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas /
translated: and went forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One.

original: des brtson pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / 'bad pas phol mig lnga pa'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di nyid g-yo zhing mi brtan par rig nas /

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad rnyil ba dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin par rtsad chod de /🔽nyon mongs pa thams cad @336a *//
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad rnyil ba dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin par rtsad chod de / nyon mongs pa thams cad @336a *//
translated: He understood that all conditioned things are subject to decay, fall, separation, and destruction.

original: spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: He abandoned all defilements and actualized the state of an arhat.

analyzed: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /

analyzed: gser dang / bong bar mnyam pa; nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He regarded gold as equal to a clod of earth, and space as equal to the palm of his hand.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: He was cool like a sandalwood tree.

original: rig pas sgo nga'i spubs bcom pa /
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i spubs bcom pa /

original: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: He had attained the insights, superknowledges, and discriminations.

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang / chags pa dang / bkur stil mi lta ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang / chags pa dang / bkur stil mi lta ba /
translated: He was not concerned with worldly gain, attachment, or praise.

original: dbang po dang / nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang / gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po dang / nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang / gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur te /
translated: He was an object of worship, veneration, and respectful address by Indra, Upendra, and the other gods.

original: de nas dge slong dag the tshom skyes te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong dag the tshom skyes te /
translated: The monks became doubtful

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: and asked the Blessed Buddha, who cuts through all doubts,

original: btsun pa / ra sthas las gang dag bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa / ra sthas las gang dag bgyis na /
translated: “Lord, what karma did Rastrapāla create

original: des phyug po'i rigs su skyes lags /
analyzed: des phyug po'i rigs su skyes lags /

original: las gang dag bgyis na des mi sdug par gyur la /
analyzed: las gang dag bgyis na des mi sdug par gyur la /
translated: What karma did he create that he became ugly,

original: rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
translated: and that after going forth he manifested arhatship?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: ra stha nyid kyis sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: ra stha nyid kyis sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub pa dang ldan te /
translated: Rastrapāla himself created the causes in other lives, accumulated the causes,

original: dba' rgal bzhin du 'byung la gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i las de dag byas shing bsags bas na /
analyzed: dba' rgal bzhin du 'byung la gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i las de dag byas shing bsags bas na /
translated: and created the causes that are like a great flood, that are certain to come, and that will not be averted.

original: ra stha nyid kyi las byas shing bsags pa de dag gzhan su zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ra stha nyid kyi las byas shing bsags pa de dag gzhan su zhig gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since he created and accumulated those causes, who else would experience the results?

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

analyzed: @336b las byas shing bsags pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin bar mi 'gyur /
translated: The actions that have been done and accumulated do not ripen externally in the earth element.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /

translated: The virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that have been done and accumulated ripen exclusively in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated.

original: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
translated: The actions of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: do not perish even after a hundred eons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the conditions are assembled and the time comes,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
translated: they will certainly ripen.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: in the past,

original: grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na tshong dpon gyi chung ma gtum zhing brlang la gzu lum can zhig 'dug go /
analyzed: grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na tshong dpon gyi chung ma gtum zhing brlang la gzu lum can zhig 'dug go /
translated: in the city of Vārāṇasī, there lived a merchant’s wife who was violent, harsh, and impetuous.

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du mi 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When the buddhas do not appear in the world,

original: rang sangs rgyas sdug cing phongs pa rnams la snying brtse ba /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas sdug cing phongs pa rnams la snying brtse ba /
translated: The pratyekabuddhas are compassionate toward the poor and destitute.

original: bas mtha'i gnas mal gyis 'tsho ba /
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas mal gyis 'tsho ba /
translated: They live in remote places.

original: 'jig rten na yon gnas gcig pu rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ste /🔽de nas re zhig na rang sangs rgyas mi sdug pa zhig de'i khyim du song ba dang / des mi sdug pa 'di lta bu nga'i khyim du ci 'dod ces spyos mang du brgyad nas khyim nas bskrad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yon gnas gcig pu rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ste / de nas re zhig na rang sangs rgyas mi sdug pa zhig de'i khyim du song ba dang / des mi sdug pa 'di lta bu nga'i khyim du ci 'dod ces spyos mang du brgyad nas khyim nas bskrad do //
translated: They are the only ones in the world worthy of receiving offerings.

original: de nas rang sangs rgyas des de la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas rang sangs rgyas des de la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: “One day a pratyekabuddha who was not attractive came to the house of the head merchant’s wife. She said, ‘What do you want in my house, you ugly thing?’ She scolded him a lot and threw him out of the house.

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba bzhin du nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas /
analyzed: ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba bzhin du nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas /
translated: “Then the pratyekabuddha rose up into the sky like a swan king stretching its wings

original: cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs bstan to //
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs bstan to //
translated: and displayed various miracles.

original: de nas tshong dpon gyi chung ma 'gyod pa skyes nas de la gzod pa gsol @337a *//
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon gyi chung ma 'gyod pa skyes nas de la gzod pa gsol @337a *//
translated: “Then the head merchant’s wife felt remorse and asked his forgiveness.

original: te; bshos kyang phul nas smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: te; bshos kyang phul nas smon lam btab pa /
translated: She offered him food and made this aspiration:

original: bdag gis rang sangs rgyas la spyos brgyad pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pa myong bar ma gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gis rang sangs rgyas la spyos brgyad pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pa myong bar ma gyur cig /
translated: “May I not experience the ripening of the karma of having reviled a solitary buddha.

original: 'di lta bu'i chos dag kyang thob par gyur cig /🔽'di las kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par gyur cig /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i chos dag kyang thob par gyur cig / 'di las kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par gyur cig /
translated: May I attain a Dharma like this.

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig ces byas so //🔽dge slong dag /
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig ces byas so // dge slong dag /
translated: May I please a teacher even more exalted than this one, and not displease him.”

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: Bhikṣus, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na tshong dpon gyi chung mar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni ra stha 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na tshong dpon gyi chung mar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni ra stha 'di yin te /
translated: At that time, the wife of the head merchant was Rāṣṭrapāla.

original: der rang sangs rgyas la bshos phul ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas ni rgyal po phyug po'i rigs su skyes so //🔽mi sdug pa'i tshig smras te //
analyzed: der rang sangs rgyas la bshos phul ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas ni rgyal po phyug po'i rigs su skyes so // mi sdug pa'i tshig smras te //
translated: The karma of offering food to the solitary buddha ripened such that she was born into a family of great means.

original: khyim nas bskrad pa des ni mi sdug par gyur to //
analyzed: khyim nas bskrad pa des ni mi sdug par gyur to //
translated: The karma of speaking unpleasant words to him and expelling him from the house ripened such that she became ugly.

original: gzhan yang / bcom ldan 'das 'od srung gi ring la rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / bcom ldan 'das 'od srung gi ring la rab tu byung ste /

analyzed: des der bslabs shing kha don du byas pa dang / phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa la mkhas par byas pa dang /

analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i gnas bsrungs pa des ni da ltar dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so; ;dge slong dag /

analyzed: de ltar na las gcig tu nges par gnag pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang gcig tu nges par gnag par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: las 'dres ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa yang 'dres mar 'gyur ro //

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /

analyzed: de bas na las gcig tu nges par gnag pa rnams dang / las 'dres ma rnams spangs la /

analyzed: las gcig tu nges par dkar pa rnams 'ba' zhig la gtad par bya ste /

analyzed: dge slong / khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /

analyzed: sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The summary:

analyzed: sdom ni / rgya mtsho dang ni snam dang // lag na gser thogs sde snod gsum //
translated: The ocean, the blanket, the one holding gold in his hand, the Tripiṭaka master,🔽Yaśoda, Suhṛdaya, the one born miraculously,

analyzed: grags bshes rdzus te skyes pa dang // mdzes ldan dang ni ka pi na //

original: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zod rnams brnyes pa /🔽nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa mnyan du yod pa na /
analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zod rnams brnyes pa / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa mnyan du yod pa na /
translated: He had obtained robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for sickness, and monastic utensils.

original: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na ded dpon zhig gnas pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na ded dpon zhig gnas pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
translated: At that time, in Śrāvastī, there was a caravan leader who had taken a wife from a family of equal rank. He enjoyed himself with her, took pleasure with her, and made love with her.

original: de rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las re zhig na de'i sems skyes pa /
analyzed: de rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las re zhig na de'i sems skyes pa /
translated: While he was enjoying himself with her, taking pleasure with her, and making love with her, at one time the thought occurred to him:

analyzed: bdag ji srid du lang tshol bab pa de srid du ni nor spel bar bya'o //
translated: “As long as I am in the prime of life, I will increase my wealth.

original: phyis rgas pa'i tshe ni bde bar longs spyod par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: phyis rgas pa'i tshe ni bde bar longs spyod par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: Later, when I am old, I will enjoy it happily.”

original: de nas ded dpon de g-yog 'khor tshong pa lnga brgya dang rgya mtsho'i gru nyos nas chung ma dang bcas te rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas ded dpon de g-yog 'khor tshong pa lnga brgya dang rgya mtsho'i gru nyos nas chung ma dang bcas te rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du zhugs so //
translated: Then the captain, together with his retinue of five hundred merchants, bought a ship on the great ocean and set out to sea with his wife.

original: de nas re zhig na de'i chung ma la bu chags nas /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na de'i chung ma la bu chags nas /
translated: After some time, his wife became pregnant.

original: rgya mtsho de nyid kyi nang du bu byung ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho de nyid kyi nang du bu byung ste /
translated: She gave birth to a son on the ocean itself.

original: khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas so //
analyzed: khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas so //
translated: The child was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: de nas de btsas pa'i btsas ston byas @338b nas; ming rgya mtsho zhes btags so //
analyzed: de nas de btsas pa'i btsas ston byas @338b nas; ming rgya mtsho zhes btags so //
translated: They celebrated the birth of the child and named him Sāgara.

original: de nas re zhig na ded dpon de gru don grub nas nye zho med par rgya mtsho chen po nas phyir 'khor te /

analyzed: de nas gang gi tshe khye'u rgya mtsho cher skyes pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: gru shol ba dang; chu 'phyag pa dang / mnyan pa dang / phye'u zul mkhan dang / ru skya 'dzin pa rnams kyang khrid de /

analyzed: de nas de dag rgya mtsho chen por song ba dang / srin po nag po'i rlung gis gru de phu mdar bskor to //

analyzed: ded dpon rgya mtsho ni mu stegs can la dga' ste /

analyzed: kye / ston pa drug dang / lha gzhan dag gis kyang khyed la ci byar yang med kyi /

analyzed: de nas ded dpon rgya mtsho la sogs pa tshong pa lnga brgya po rnams kyis skad bsnyams te /

analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod la skom pa'i gnod pa med ces byas so //

analyzed: bdag gi mche ba gnyis las chu yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa 'byung ste /

analyzed: des nas bdag la skom pa'i gnod pa med do //

analyzed: btsun pa / grags bshes 'dis las gang dag bgyis na /

analyzed: des gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa dang / mche ba @357b gnyis las chu bo yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa 'byung la /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag /

analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not ripen in the element of water, in the element of fire, or in the element of wind.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa rnams ni zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'ba' zhig la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa rnams ni zin pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'ba' zhig la rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The actions, whether virtuous or nonvirtuous, that have been done and accumulated ripen exclusively in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated.

original: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can dag gi las rnams ni //
translated: The actions of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the conditions are assembled and the time has come,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
translated: they will certainly bear fruit.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: in the past,

original: bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye dgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /🔽rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye dgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas / rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: in this fortunate aeon, when the lifespan of beings was twenty thousand years, there appeared in the world a teacher named Kāśyapa, a blessed one,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened buddha, a knowledgeable and venerable one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a sugata, a knower of the world,🔽a steersman who guides beings,

original: @358a *// skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /🔽bla na med pa /🔽lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: @358a *// skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba / bla na med pa / lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: He was the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a Bhagavat named Kāśyapa.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srung zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srung zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: He appeared in the world.

original: de grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags na rten cing bzhugs so //
analyzed: de grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags na rten cing bzhugs so //
translated: He lived and dwelt in the Deer Park in Vārāṇasī, the place of sages.

original: de nas re zhig na tshong dpon gyi bu zhig dge slong rgan po zhig la rab tu byung ba las /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na tshong dpon gyi bu zhig dge slong rgan po zhig la rab tu byung ba las /
translated: Then, after some time, a son of a merchant went forth to that elder monk.

original: de'ang le lo can zhig ste /
analyzed: de'ang le lo can zhig ste /
translated: But he was lazy.

original: gzhan la de bsnyen bkur byed mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan la de bsnyen bkur byed mi 'dod do //
translated: He did not want to serve others.

original: de nas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis gnas brtan de nyid kyi bsnyen bkur byed par bskos pa dang / de bdag ni bsnyen bkur byed pa yin no snyam du rgya cher 'dzin te /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis gnas brtan de nyid kyi bsnyen bkur byed par bskos pa dang / de bdag ni bsnyen bkur byed pa yin no snyam du rgya cher 'dzin te /
translated: Then, when the fellow practitioners of pure action appointed him to serve that elder, he thought, “I am the one who should be served,” and he became very conceited.

original: dge slong ches rgan pa rnams kyi bsnyen bkur len par byed pas na /
analyzed: dge slong ches rgan pa rnams kyi bsnyen bkur len par byed pas na /
translated: He took on the service of monks who were much older than him.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zad de /
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zad de /
translated: Because of that, his roots of virtue were exhausted.

original: phyis re zhig na nad kyis btab pa dang / gnas brtan gyis sman pa'i lung bzhin du sman mar blud nas /
analyzed: phyis re zhig na nad kyis btab pa dang / gnas brtan gyis sman pa'i lung bzhin du sman mar blud nas /
translated: After some time, he became ill. The elder gave him medicine in accordance with the doctor’s instructions.

original: de mtshan mo skom ste ci bya gtol med nas chu btung snyam ste /
analyzed: de mtshan mo skom ste ci bya gtol med nas chu btung snyam ste /
translated: At night he became thirsty. Not knowing what to do, he thought, “I will drink water.”

original: bdag gi chu snod kyi drung du song na chu med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi chu snod kyi drung du song na chu med par mthong ngo //
translated: He went to his water pot, but saw that it was empty.

original: de bzhin du mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / dge 'dun gyi drung tshang du song na de dag kyang chu med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / dge 'dun gyi drung tshang du song na de dag kyang chu med par mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, he went to the water pots of his preceptor, his teacher, and the saṅgha, but saw that they were all empty.

original: de nas re zhig na chu klung zlog byed kyi 'gram du song na de'ang chu med par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na chu klung zlog byed kyi 'gram du song na de'ang chu med par gyur te /
translated: After some time, he went to the bank of the river Nairañjanā, but it was also empty.

original: de mi dga' bar gyur nas bdag gi @358b tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams skyo ba skyed pa dang / dad pas byin pa lci bar bstan pa'i phyir chu klung zlog byed kyi pha rol na shing zhig yod pa la 'dzegs te /
analyzed: de mi dga' bar gyur nas bdag gi @358b tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams skyo ba skyed pa dang / dad pas byin pa lci bar bstan pa'i phyir chu klung zlog byed kyi pha rol na shing zhig yod pa la 'dzegs te /
translated: He became unhappy. In order to make his fellow brahmacārin feel remorse and to make them feel the weight of the offerings of the faithful, he climbed a tree on the far bank of the river Nairañjanā.

original: ras shig der btags nas /
analyzed: ras shig der btags nas /
translated: He tied a cloth there.

original: rang gi las rnams las bsams te las la rten cing 'dug go /
analyzed: rang gi las rnams las bsams te las la rten cing 'dug go /
translated: He thought about his karma and relied on his karma.

analyzed: de nas re zhig na phyi de nyin par nam nangs pa dang / gtam de tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la bsnyad do //
translated: Then, the next day at dawn, he told that story to his fellow practitioners.

original: de nas de'i tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis skabs de thos nas mi dga' bar gyur te phan tshun du bsnyad do //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis skabs de thos nas mi dga' bar gyur te phan tshun du bsnyad do //
translated: When his fellow practitioners heard that story, they were unhappy and told each other.

original: de nas de'i mkhan pos chu byin na de'ang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas de'i mkhan pos chu byin na de'ang ma mthong ngo //
translated: Then, when his preceptor gave him water, he did not see it.

original: de nas de mi dga' bar gyur nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das 'od srung la gsol to //
analyzed: de nas de mi dga' bar gyur nas / bcom ldan 'das 'od srung la gsol to //
translated: Then, he became unhappy🔽and told Blessed Kāśyapa.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od srung gis gandi rdungs shig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od srung gis gandi rdungs shig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Blessed Kāśyapa said, “Ring the bell.”

original: de nas khang skyong gis gandi brdungs pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams 'dus so //
analyzed: de nas khang skyong gis gandi brdungs pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams 'dus so //
translated: Then, when the caretaker rang the bell, the saṅgha of monks, with the Buddha at their head, gathered.

original: grong khyer w'a ra n'a si'i thog thag tu yang gtam de grags te /
analyzed: grong khyer w'a ra n'a si'i thog thag tu yang gtam de grags te /
translated: The news spread throughout the city of Vārāṇasī,

original: sems can 'bum phrag du ma 'dus so //
analyzed: sems can 'bum phrag du ma 'dus so //
translated: and many hundreds of thousands of sentient beings gathered.

original: de nas re zhig na de'i mkhan pos gral dpon gyi mdun du 'dug tu bcug nas /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na de'i mkhan pos gral dpon gyi mdun du 'dug tu bcug nas /
translated: After some time, his preceptor made him sit in front of the row of monks.

original: ril ba spyi blugs chus bkang ste phyin nas /
analyzed: ril ba spyi blugs chus bkang ste phyin nas /
translated: He filled a water pot and gave it to him, saying,

original: bu; chu 'di dge 'dun la brims shig ces byas so //
analyzed: bu; chu 'di dge 'dun la brims shig ces byas so //
translated: “Son, distribute this water to the saṅgha.”

original: de nas 'bras bu mngon sum du mthong ba des skye bar gyur pa de nyid kyis /
analyzed: de nas 'bras bu mngon sum du mthong ba des skye bar gyur pa de nyid kyis /
translated: Then, because he had seen the fruits of his actions,

original: bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos @359a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos @359a *//
translated: he developed faith in the Blessed One and the hearers.

original: rnams la dad pa bskyed nas bsam pa drag pos chu de dge 'dun la brims so //
analyzed: rnams la dad pa bskyed nas bsam pa drag pos chu de dge 'dun la brims so //
translated: With a strong intention, he distributed the water to the saṅgha.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la phan gdags pa'i phyir phyag glang po che'i sna lta bu brkyang nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la phan gdags pa'i phyir phyag glang po che'i sna lta bu brkyang nas /
translated: Then, in order to benefit him, the Blessed One extended his trunk-like arm

original: 'jigs pa thams cad dbugs 'byin par byed pa'i phyag gis chu de bzhes te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad dbugs 'byin par byed pa'i phyag gis chu de bzhes te /
translated: and with his hand, which brings relief from all fear, accepted the water.

original: nyan thos chen po rnams kyis kyang blangs na /
analyzed: nyan thos chen po rnams kyis kyang blangs na /
translated: The great hearers also accepted it,

original: 'on kyang zad par ma gyur to //
analyzed: 'on kyang zad par ma gyur to //
translated: but it was not exhausted.

original: dge 'dun thams cad la brims na'ang zad par ma gyur to //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad la brims na'ang zad par ma gyur to //
translated: Even when it was distributed to the entire saṅgha, it was not exhausted.

original: de nas lha dang / mi rnams dad par byed pa'i cho 'phrul ya mtshan can de mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas lha dang / mi rnams dad par byed pa'i cho 'phrul ya mtshan can de mthong nas /
translated: Then, having seen that wondrous miracle which inspired the faith of gods and men,

original: srog chags 'bum phrag du mas bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: srog chags 'bum phrag du mas bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
translated: many hundreds of thousands of living beings saw the truth.

original: de'i rgyud la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams sor chud par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i rgyud la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams sor chud par gyur to //
translated: And the roots of virtue of the one who had been sick were restored.

original: gang gi tshe nad sos pa de'i tshe des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun chus mi brel bar byas te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nad sos pa de'i tshe des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun chus mi brel bar byas te /
translated: When he was cured, he provided water for the community of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: lo khri nyis stong gi bar du des dge 'dun la chu brims so //
analyzed: lo khri nyis stong gi bar du des dge 'dun la chu brims so //
translated: For twelve thousand years he served water to the community.

original: de nas phyis re zhig na 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas phyis re zhig na 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa'i tshe /
translated: Then, later, when the time of his death arrived,

original: smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: smon lam btab pa /
translated: he made this prayer:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sems bskyed pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su gtong ba 'dis na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sems bskyed pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su gtong ba 'dis na /
translated: “By this root of virtue, by this arousing of the mind, by this giving up of the gift of the Dharma,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma la bram ze'i khye'u khyod skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya thub pa na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes @359b bya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa gang yin pa de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
translated: I will please him, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni, to whom it was prophesied, ‘You will become the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni.’🔽

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
translated: I will please him and not displease him.

original: bdag gi mche ba'i phrag nas kyang chu yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa 'byung bar gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: bdag gi mche ba'i phrag nas kyang chu yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa 'byung bar gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: May water endowed with the eight qualities flow from my tusks.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni grags bshes 'di yin te /
translated: The one who was the monk then is now Yaśoda.

analyzed: des lo khri nyis stong gi bar du dge 'dun la chu brims te smon lam btab pa des na /
translated: For twelve thousand years he served water to the saṅgha and made an aspiration.

analyzed: tshe 'di la mche ba'i phrag nas chu 'byung ba rgyu de nyid kyis na dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Because of that cause, in this life water flowed from his tusks and he manifested arhatship.”

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: de ltar na las gcig tu nges par gnag pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang gcig tu nges par gnag par 'gyur ro // las gcig tu nges par dkar ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang gcig tu nges par dkar par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, actions that are absolutely black will ripen absolutely black.🔽Actions that are absolutely white will ripen absolutely white.

original: las 'dres ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang 'dres mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'dres ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa'ang 'dres mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mixed actions will ripen as mixed.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

analyzed: de bas na las gcig tu nges par gnag pa rnams dang / las 'dres ma rnams spangs la /
translated: therefore, abandon actions that are absolutely black and mixed.

analyzed: las gcig tu nges par dkar ba rnams 'ba' zhig la gtad par bya ste /
translated: You should only engage in actions that are absolutely white.

original: dge slong khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Monks, you should train in this way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /🔽dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das @360a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas / dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das @360a *//
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken these words,

original: kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
analyzed: kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
translated: the monks rejoiced and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: rdzus te skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzus te skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Miraculous birth” means

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang /
translated: guild masters, caravan leaders, gods, nāgas,🔽yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas / bla mar byas / ri mor byas / mchod pa byas te /
translated: He was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.🔽The Blessed Buddha was greatly meritorious,

analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis mchod cing shes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: and he was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
translated: He had obtained robes, food, bedding, seats, remedies for sickness, and medicinal herbs.

analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul na shing gi rgyal po yongs 'du sa rtol gyi drung nas thag mi ring ba zhig na /
translated: He was staying in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, not far from the foot of the Pāruṣaka tree, the king of trees, together with the saṅgha of hearers.

analyzed: rdo leb snam bu dkar po lta bu'i steng du dbyar gnas par dam bzhes te /
translated: He had taken a vow to stay there during the rainy season, on a flat rock that resembled a white blanket.

analyzed: sku bskrun pa'i yum dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha gzhan dag la'ang chos ston to //
translated: He was teaching the Dharma to his mother, who had taken rebirth as a god in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, and to other gods.

analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang @360b ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po ni mnyan du yod pa na /

analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dbyar gnas par dam bcas so //
translated: in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, having taken a vow to stay there during the rainy season.

analyzed: de nas 'khor bzhi po rnams tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas /
translated: Then the four retinues went to the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, and having arrived,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen pos smras @361a *//

analyzed: sku bskrun pa'i yum dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha gzhan dag la'ang chos ston cing bzhugs so zhes thos so //

analyzed: chos kyi gtam rnam grangs du mas yang dag par bstan /

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /

analyzed: btsun pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po /

analyzed: nyam nga ba chung ngam /

analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po'i rkang pa la mgo bos phyag btsal te stan las langs te dong ngo //

analyzed: ji ltar sems mnyam par bzhag na /

analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i yul na shing gi rgyal po yongs 'du sa rtol gyi drung nas thag mi ring ba zhig na rdo leb snam bu dkar po lta bur 'dug pa der son par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so
translated: and arrived at a flat stone not far from the Pāruṣyaka tree, king of the gods, in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: // de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das ni lha'i 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i gung la bzhugs te chos ston to //

analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'dzum dmul te /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po'i sems thugs kyis mkhyen nas /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen pos smras pa la mthun par dgongs te /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: kye ma / lha'i 'khor sna tshogs 'dus shing 'khod do //

analyzed: lus dang bral nas 'dir skyes pa'i lha de lta bu dag kyang yod do //
